snippet: A civil trial does not guarantee that anyone would be held accountable for the crimes committed at the American prison in Iraq, but it would be an important start.
abstract: Editorial notes federal trial in Virginia will take up case over whether American contractors CACI International Inc and L-3 Services Inc can be sued in American courts over abuse and torture at Abu Ghraib prison during Iraq war; holds contractors must be held responsible for horrific torture and abuse of detainees and keeping federal courts from getting involved in case would be wrong.
lead_paragraph: A civil trial does not guarantee that anyone would be held accountable for the crimes committed at the American prison in Iraq, but it would be an important start.

headline.print_headline: Will Anyone Pay for Abu Ghraib?
headline.main: Will Anyone Pay for Abu Ghraib?
